availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
I, Thomas E. Bramlette, GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMOWEALTH,
TO ALL SHERIFFS AND CONSTABLES IN SAID COMMONWEALTH, GREETING:

WHEREAS, It has been made known to me by Richard Yates Governor of the State of Illinois that a certain Arch Means of said State stands indicted in the Richard Circuit Court for Kidnapping a copy of which indictment, duly authenticated, is now on file in this Department; and that the said Arch. Means has fled from the State of Illinois, thereby evading the justice of its laws, and is going at large within the limits of the State of Kentucky.

Know Ye, Therefore, That I, THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE, Governor as aforesaid, do hereby require and enjoin all Sheriffs and Constables within this State to apprehend and arrest the said Arch Means, and upon his apprehension, to bring him before some Circuit Judge of this Commonwealth, that the said Circuit Judge may proceed, by proper and legal testimony, to inquire into the matter, so far as shall be necessary, to ascertain the identity of the said Arch Means and if he is the person mentioned in this, my warrant, , that the said Judge may order him to be delivered up to Wm L. Manson, who has been duly authorized by the Governor of the State of Illinois to receive and convey the said Arch Means to the State of Illinois, to be dealt with according to law: And in case the said Wm L. Manson should not appear to receive him, that the Judge may commit him, the said Arch Means to jail, on the charge aforesaid, to be dealt with according to law: and that you report forthwith to the Governor of this Commonwealth your proceedings under this warrant. And furthermore, that if the said Arch Means shall be committed to the jail of any county in this State, that the Judge so committing him may immediately inform the Governor of this Commonwealth your proceedings under this warrant. And furthermore, that if the said Arch Means shall be committed to the jail of any county in this State, that the Judge so committing him may immediately inform the Governor of this Commonwealth of the commitment thereof, and to what jail he has been committed.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL.

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed, at FRANKFORT, the 6th day of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and Sixty 72ndfour, and in the 723rd year of the Commonwealth.

Thos E Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
E. L. VanWinkle, SECRETARY OF STATE.
By Jas R. Page
Asst Secty

Not Executed: the Defendant A. Means left this county on or about the time this warrant was received & has not been found it since
Feby 17th 1865
J. H. Eastham S. B. C
